meanings.definition: Demonstrate the truth or existence of something by evidence or argument.
meanings.sent1: She used facts to prove her point in the debate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted experiments to prove his hypothesis.
meanings.sent3: The detective needed to prove the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: Her actions would prove her loyalty to the team.
meanings.sent5: The math problem was difficult, but she managed to prove the solution.

meanings.definition: Show oneself to be competent or capable.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to prove his skills by completing the challenging task.
meanings.sent2: The new employee worked hard to prove herself to her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to prove his ability to cook under pressure.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication would prove her worth to the company.
meanings.sent5: The student aimed to prove his knowledge by acing the exam.
